Airports are working to resolve the issue, while Frankfurt Airport confirmed it was unaffected.

title: Public, NGOs should be allowed to provide shelter to aggressive dogs: Karnataka Lokayukta
description: On September 18, the Special Commissioner (Health and Education), Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA), submitted a report on steps taken to increase Animal Birth Control (ABC) surgeries, make better use of kennels, and address staff shortages that have slowed implementation of animal husbandry programmes

description: Petitioners allege Bombay High Court ruling offered ‘incomplete justice’, seek ecological restoration and accountability.

title: Defence pact: Pak minister asked if Saudi will step in if war with India – What Khawaja Asif said
description: Pakistan's defence minister claims Saudi Arabia will support Pakistan in case of war with India, citing their new defence pact ensuring mutual assistance if either nation is attacked. India has responded cautiously, stating it will study the implications of the agreement on its national security and regional stability, while acknowledging the formalization of a long-standing arrangement.

title: ‘When will this end?’: Kejriwal slams BJP over repeated bomb threats in Delhi
description: Arvind Kejriwal criticized the BJP government for failing to address repeated bomb threats targeting Delhi schools. Several schools, including DPS Dwarka, received threats, causing widespread panic and evacuations. Kejriwal highlighted the lack of arrests or action taken despite a year of such incidents, questioning the government's ability to ensure the capital's security.

title: iOS 26 new features: Top 20 upgrades; transform your daily iPhone use
description: iOS 26 introduces subtle yet impactful upgrades, enhancing productivity and personalization. The update focuses on improving daily iPhone use through features like customizable alarms, easy ringtone creation, and selective text copying. It also includes intelligent tools such as spatial photos, visual intelligence for screenshots, and real-time lyric translations, making the iPhone smarter and more tailored.

title: How to make English Studies relevant to today’s students
description: The English Studies curriculum must explore technology’s humanising potential and offer paths toward critical inquiry and progressive human reform

Trump’s $100K fee on H-1B visa: Amazon issues deadline; asks staff to return
description: Following Microsoft, Amazon is advising H-1B and H-4 visa holders to return to the U.S. before September 21st due to potential entry restrictions. This follows President Trump's executive order imposing a $100,000 annual fee on H-1B visas. Amazon, a top recipient of H-1B visas, urges employees to stay in the country.

title: Dunith Wellalage returns to Sri Lanka squad ahead of Asia Cup super four clash
description: Young spinner Dunith Wellalage has rejoined the Sri Lankan squad in the UAE and is available for selection in their Asia Cup Super Four match against Bangladesh on Saturday, following the death of his father. Despite the personal tragedy, the young all-rounder returned to fulfill his national duty, showcasing remarkable commitment.

‘Created by nature’: DKS blames vehicles, traffic, rain for pothole-riddled roads; slams BJP
description: Karnataka's Deputy CM, DK Shivakumar, attributes Bengaluru's pothole problem to natural causes like heavy rain and traffic, countering criticism of negligence. Despite repairing over 7,000 potholes, thousands remain, prompting a police report and citizen involvement. Shivakumar also refuted claims of IT companies leaving due to poor infrastructure, asserting the government won't be threatened.

Malviya accused Congress of prioritizing appeasement over national interest and having a soft corner for Pakistan. He further linked these statements to the historical context of Partition, accusing the party of a continued pattern.

What causes constipation? 5 underlying reasons explained; simple ways to tackle them
description: Constipation is associated with a sense of discomfort and its symptoms generally include: Less than three bowel movements a week, passing hard or lumpy stools, feeling of blockage in the rectum. In most cases, is caused by lifestyle factors and eating habits and can be relieved without the help of medication. Severe or persistent constipation can signal underlying medical conditions, in such cases it is advised that individuals seek medical advice.

Now battling for his life in a government hospital, Venkatesh's condition is critical as the venom spreads, leaving the local community in disbelief.

Barc making reactor for Navy’s next-gen N-subs
description: Bhabha Atomic Research Centre is developing a powerful 200 MWe reactor to significantly enhance the endurance of the Indian Navy's future submarines, including the S-5 class. This upgrade, more than doubling the power of existing reactors, is crucial for strengthening India's sea-based nuclear deterrent amidst China's growing naval capabilities.

title: UP horror: Man stabs pregnant wife to death over Rs 100; mother injured
description: In Lucknow, Ankur murdered his pregnant wife, Neelam, after she refused to give him Rs 100 for alcohol. He attacked her with a stick and then stabbed her multiple times. His mother, Phoolkumari, was seriously injured when she tried to intervene, while Ankur has been arrested and is now in jail.

title: 'Faced racial hatred, food was poisoned’: Last post of Indian shot dead in US
description: Mohammed Nizamuddin, a software engineer from Telangana, was fatally shot by Santa Clara police. Prior to his death, he posted on LinkedIn alleging racial discrimination, workplace harassment, and wage fraud at his former company. Nizamuddin claimed he faced a hostile environment, his food was poisoned, and he was being evicted for fighting injustice.

title: Sensex's 1-year returns = 0%: Why are Indian stocks flat for over 12 months
‘He had a seizure attack during second swim’: Wife recalls how Zubeen Garg died in Singapore
description: Assamese singer Zubeen Garg tragically passed away in Singapore after a seizure while swimming. He was there to perform at the North East India Festival. His wife refuted claims of scuba diving, stating he had a seizure. The CM is arranging to bring his remains back to Assam for public tribute, as fans mourn the loss of a cultural icon.

title: Vadodara: Stones pelted at ‘vajra’ police vehicle over social post; probe under way
description: Tension flared in Godhra as mobs pelted stones at police after a man was brought in for questioning regarding a religious poster video circulating online. Police used force to disperse the crowd, intensifying patrols. Authorities clarified the man was cautioned against disruptive content ahead of Navratri, denying allegations of assault.

title: ‘Complete failure’: Baby survives 4th-floor fall; dies after being stuck in traffic
description: A 16-month-old boy died in traffic on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad National Highway after falling from a Nalasopara balcony. The family was transporting him to a Mumbai hospital for treatment of serious injuries. This incident follows a similar tragedy where a woman died due to traffic delays after a tree fall, raising concerns about traffic management on the highway.

title: Inoue vs Nakatani: Japan loses boxing night; Saudi Arabia grabs spotlight
description: Japanese boxing fans will miss a historic Tokyo Dome event as Ring V: Night of the Samurai moves to Riyadh’s Mohammed Abdo Arena on December 27. Headlined by Naoya Inoue and co-featured by Junto Nakatani, the shift frustrates local fans, though fighters earn record paydays, marking Saudi Arabia’s growing presence in global boxing.
